title: 70's Typeface
content:
Hi

Does any one know what this typeface is?

It was used a lot in 70's ads.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [IMG\_0151.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160110/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0151.jpg) | 35.87 KB |
author: davidsanmiguel

comments.content: ITC Bookman Swash. Some of these glyphs are available as alternates in [ITC Bookman Std](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160110/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_bookman_std_medium_italic/?&sample_text=Righteous%20Freudian%20Slip&acs_ss=0) or Jukebox’s [Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160110/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085).
